poem:
### Wings of Oversight

making planes—  
a dance,    
overseen lightly,  
by clouds of safety  

tools & parts,  
join in trust,  

yet---

in the great metal  
silence,  
where  
oversight  
breathes thin---

the watchful eye  
slumbers,  
and errors  
whisper in the wings.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US oversight of Boeing airplane production inadequate, watchdog says A federal watchdog on Friday criticized the Federal Aviation Administration’s oversight of Boeing airplane production, saying it did not have an effective system to oversee the US plane maker’s individual manufacturing facilities. The transportation department’s office of inspector general said in a report the FAA’s current audit processes “are not comprehensive enough to adequately identify key discrepancies and noncompliances within the Boeing production line” and said". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
